    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static Args of(java.lang.String[] args,
                      java.util.Properties properties)
               throws DuplicateOptionException,
                      TypeMapperNotFoundException,
                      UnrecognizedArgException,
                      InvalidArgException

        Create new instance of the default command line argument parser. The defaul is a POSIX parser see PosixGetopt. Will build options from the supplied bean container object.

        The supplied bean container can be a Class<?>, array of bean containers new Object[]{Class<?>...}, a collection of bean containers Arrays.asList(bean1, Class<?>), etc. Bean containers are scanned recursively and as other containers are discovered, they are added to the list of beans for options.

        Parameters:
        args - the command line args to parse
        properties - a JRE Properties container from which options will be created
        Throws:
        DuplicateOptionException - (unchecked) thrown if duplicate option is declared within the bean container, options are equal if their option names are equal Option.name()
        TypeMapperNotFoundException - (unchecked) every option provided must have a string to value type mapper registered with the OptionsRegistry
        UnrecognizedArgException - (checked) thrown by the parser if the command line args contain an option looking arg but no option has been defined
        InvalidArgException - (checked) thrown by the parser if unable to process an options argument. The exception means that option was matched and found, but its argument can not be processed or is missing

      • ofOptional

        public static java.util.Optional<Args> ofOptional(java.lang.String[] args,
                                                  java.util.Properties properties)
                                           throws DuplicateOptionException,
                                                  TypeMapperNotFoundException

        Create new instance of the default command line argument parser and dispatches instead of throws parser argument exceptions. The defaul is a POSIX parser see PosixGetopt. The parser will use the provided options.

        Any parser errors, the checked exceptions, are dispatched to the error handler instead of being thrown. If any error did occur, an empty optional is returned instead of the arg parser. The error handler has access to the arg parser which dispatched the error using ArgException.getArgs() method.

        The supplied bean container can be a Class<?>, array of bean containers new Object[]{Class<?>...}, a collection of bean containers Arrays.asList(bean1, Class<?>), etc. Bean containers are scanned recursively and as other containers are discovered, they are added to the list of beans for options.

        Parameters:
        args - the command line args to parse
        properties - a JRE Properties container from which options will be created
        Returns:
        the parser is returned if no error was encountered, otherwise any empty Optional.empty() is returned and the error handler is notified
        Throws:
        DuplicateOptionException - (unchecked) thrown if duplicate option is passed within the options array, options are equal if their option names are equal Option.name()
        TypeMapperNotFoundException - (unchecked) every option provided must have a string to value type mapper registered with the OptionsRegistry

      • ofOptional

        public static java.util.Optional<Args> ofOptional(java.lang.String[] args,
                                                  java.util.Properties properties,
                                                  java.util.function.Consumer<ArgException> errorHandler)
                                           throws DuplicateOptionException,
                                                  TypeMapperNotFoundException

        Create new instance of the default command line argument parser and dispatches instead of throws parser argument exceptions. The defaul is a POSIX parser see PosixGetopt. The parser will use the provided options.

        Any parser errors, the checked exceptions, are dispatched to the error handler instead of being thrown. If any error did occur, an empty optional is returned instead of the arg parser. The error handler has access to the arg parser which dispatched the error using ArgException.getArgs() method.

        The supplied bean container can be a Class<?>, array of bean containers new Object[]{Class<?>...}, a collection of bean containers Arrays.asList(bean1, Class<?>), etc. Bean containers are scanned recursively and as other containers are discovered, they are added to the list of beans for options.

        Parameters:
        args - the command line args to parse
        properties - a JRE Properties container from which options will be created
        errorHandler - the error handler that will be notified of any parser exceptions
        Returns:
        the parser is returned if no error was encountered, otherwise any empty Optional.empty() is returned and the error handler is notified
        Throws:
        DuplicateOptionException - (unchecked) thrown if duplicate option is passed within the options array, options are equal if their option names are equal Option.name()
        TypeMapperNotFoundException - (unchecked) every option provided must have a string to value type mapper registered with the OptionsRegistry
